top_categories.workout_context: Jeroboam’s 186-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Jeroboam’s mixed terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Jeroboam isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Jeroboam’s mixed terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Jeroboam intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Jeroboam when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Jeroboam — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Jeroboam’s 23,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Jeroboam rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 186 miles, Jeroboam rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Jeroboam — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed terrain.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Jeroboam. Make this intensity feel like home.

race_overlay.heat: July in Erbusco, Lombardy, Italy can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Jeroboam. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 186 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 186 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Jeroboam. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Jeroboam demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 186 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 186 miles of mixed terrain in Erbusco, Lombardy, Italy.
